Class CollectionFileManager

java.lang.Object
com.utils.CollectionFileManager
public class CollectionFileManager extends Object
Manages file operations for loading and saving the music band collection. This class handles reading from and writing to CSV files, path resolution, and environment configuration management.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    CollectionFileManager.LoadResult
    Result object for load operations containing success status, loaded bands, and warnings.
    static class 
    CollectionFileManager.SaveResult
    Result object for save operations containing success status and details.

  • Constructor Details

    • CollectionFileManager

      public CollectionFileManager()

  • Method Details

    • save

      public static CollectionFileManager.SaveResult save(List<MusicBand> bands, String filePath)
      Saves the list of music bands to the specified file path. The data is stored in a custom format using field delimiters and band delimiters.
      Parameters:
      bands - the list of music bands to save
      filePath - the path to save the file to
      Returns:
      a SaveResult object indicating success or failure with details

    • load

      public static CollectionFileManager.LoadResult load(String filePath)
      Loads the music band collection from the specified file path. Parses the custom format and reconstructs MusicBand objects.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to load from
      Returns:
      a LoadResult object containing the loaded bands or error information

    • getEnvFilePath

      public static String getEnvFilePath()
      Gets the file path to the environment configuration file. The .env file contains paths to data files.
      Returns:
      the path to the environment file

    • readDataPathsFromEnv

      public static List<String> readDataPathsFromEnv()
      Reads the list of data file paths from the environment configuration file. Lines starting with # are treated as comments and ignored.
      Returns:
      a list of file paths to use for data storage

    • createDefaultEnvFile

      public static void createDefaultEnvFile()
      Creates a default environment configuration file with default data paths. This is called automatically if no .env file exists.

    • resolvePath

      public static String resolvePath(String path)
      Resolves a file path, expanding the tilde (~) to the user's home directory.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to resolve
      Returns:
      the resolved absolute path, or null if the input is invalid

    • getFirstValidPath

      public static String getFirstValidPath()
      Gets the first valid (readable) file path from the configuration. Returns the first path that exists and is readable.
      Returns:
      the first valid file path, or a default path if none exist

    • getFirstWritablePath

      public static String getFirstWritablePath()
      Gets the first writable file path from the configuration. Returns the first path that either exists and is writable, or has a writable parent directory.
      Returns:
      the first writable file path, or a default path if none are writable
